header_summary: Dave raises a question about the scenario where both A and M are members of a thieving group and suggests that they can attempt theft without losing anything if the CSV is set for a significant amount of time. John emphasizes the importance of catering to casual users in Bitcoin and praises Lightning for its scalability. Dr Maxim Orlovsky plans to create a simpler paper explaining their proposed generic model, while Vincenzo Palazzo introduces the "Lightning Network Interoperability Initiative." Sergi Delgado Segura announces the upcoming Bitcoin Research Day, and ZmnSCPxj proposes the concept of sidepools as a solution to mis-allocating funds on the Lightning Network.

recent_posts.title: Actuarial System To Reduce Interactivity In N-of-N (N	> 2) Multiparticipant Offchain Mechanisms
recent_posts.summary:
- Dave raises a question about A providing a confirmed transaction to B and generating a different transaction.
- If CSV expiry is far in the future, thieving group's success probability increases without controlling much hash rate.
- Dave suggests double spending by A would invalidate cut-through transactions and rely on reputational trust.

recent_posts.title: Scaling Lightning With Simple Covenants
recent_posts.summary:
- John emphasizes the importance of catering to casual users in Bitcoin.
- He suggests that resizing channels can be done off-chain with hierarchical channels and timeout-trees.
- John proposes that interactivity can be limited by implementing these proposals.

recent_posts.title: Trustless 2-way-peg without softfork
recent_posts.summary:
- The sender received feedback on their proposal to simplify the "Prometheus" model.
- They plan to create a paper focusing on applying the model to a two-way peg.
- The sender will share their work with the mailing list after a few weeks.

recent_posts.title: Announcing the Lightning Network Interoperability Initiative
recent_posts.summary:
- Vincent has proposed the "Lightning Network Interoperability Initiative" for integration testing and stress testing.
- The initiative aims to create language-agnostic tools for various types of integration tests.
- Vincent has made progress and developed tools like lnprototest, open to community feedback and collaboration.

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin Research Day 2023
recent_posts.summary:
- The upcoming Bitcoin Research Day will be held in Midtown NYC on October 27th, 2023.
- The event aims to discuss the robustness, security, and decentralization of the Bitcoin system.
- The conference will feature longer format talks and lightning talks for ongoing research projects.

recent_posts.title: Sidepools For Improving Payment Reliability At Scale
recent_posts.summary:
- The sender discusses the difficulty of predicting liquidity allocation on the Lightning Network.
- They propose the concept of sidepools to manage allocation without closing channels.
- Sidepools help maintain liquidity, preserve privacy, and mitigate liquidity fluctuations during buyer movements.

active_posts.title: Blinded 2-party Musig2
active_posts.summary:
- In the implementation of statechains, the server remains blind to key information and the message being signed.
- The 2-of-2 musig2 protocol involves key and nonce aggregation to generate the final signature.
- Party 1 is blinded in the process, without access to the final signature or message.

active_posts.title: Concern about "Inscriptions"
active_posts.summary:
- The question of blockchain storage sufficiency is answered by various factors.
- With a maximum block size of 4MB and a 10-minute block time, yearly growth would be 210.24GB.
- Affordable hardware and optimization efforts make blockchain storage sufficient for practical usage.

active_posts.title: Concrete MATT opcodes
active_posts.summary:
- Salvatore Ingala has presented a complete proposal for the core opcodes of MATT.
- The proposal includes replacing OP_CHECK{IN, OUT}CONTRACTVERIFY with a single opcode, OP_CHECKCONTRACTVERIFY (CCV).
- The new opcode, along with OP_CAT, achieves the full generality of MATT.

active_posts.title: Resumable channels using OP_CHECKSIGFROMSTACK
active_posts.summary:
- The proposal introduces a new type of channel funding transaction for lightning channels.
- It addresses the issue of channel backups and inability to resume channel operations.
- The proposal also discusses bandwidth-saving methods and concludes with alternative options.

active_posts.title: LN Summit 2024 Organization
active_posts.summary:
- Antoine Riard proposes organizing the LN Summit in Africa in June 2024.
- The announcement is made in advance to address complexities and ensure fairness.
- Interested Lightning Network developers are encouraged to participate and share feedback.

active_posts.title: Remotely control your lightning node from your favorite HSM
active_posts.summary:
- Bastien has submitted a pull request to the bLIPs repository to document an idea.
- The idea involves using a hardware security module as a whitelisted lightning peer.
- Bastien suggests implementing this concept with minimal changes to the lightning node and offers to contribute.
